rdf:Description.dc:description:
In SKG-IF, it is used in the following classes (domain): * schema:Audience
In SKG-IF, it is used to link to entities belonging to the following data types (range): * xsd:string

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: odrl:Policy
rdf:Description.dc:description:
The properties that can be used with this class are:
* dcterms:description -[0..N]-> xsd:string * foaf:page -[0..N]-> foaf:Document * odrl:action -[0..N]-> odrl:Action * odrl:target -[0..N]-> owl:Thing

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: schema:Audience
rdf:Description.dc:description:
The properties that can be used with this class are:
* schema:audienceType -[0..N]-> xsd:string

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: dcat:DataService (SKG-IF labels: Data source)
rdf:Description.dc:description:
The properties that can be used with this class are:
* datacite:hasIdentifier -[0..N]-> datacite:Identifier * dcat:theme -[0..N]-> owl:Thing * dcterms:conformsTo -[0..N]-> dcterms:Standard * dcterms:coverage -[0..N]-> owl:Thing * dcterms:subject -[0..N]-> owl:Thing * foaf:name -[0..N]-> rdfs:Literal * odrl:hasPolicy -[0..N]-> odrl:Policy * schema:audience -[0..N]-> schema:Audience

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: SKG-O: data-source
rdf:Description.dc:title: The SKG-IF Ontology: data-source
rdf:Description.dc:creator: Scientific Knowledge Graphs â€“ Interoperability Framework (SKG-IF) WG
rdf:Description.dc:rights: This work is distributed under a Creative Commons Attribution License (https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/legalcode)
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: SKG-O, the SKG-IF Ontology, is not yet another bibliographic ontology. Rather it is just a place where existing and complementary ontological entities from several other ontologies, all employed in the Scientific Knowledge Graph Interoperability Framework (SKG-IF), are grouped together for the purpose of providing descriptive metadata compliant with the SKG-IF Data Model.
